com.cyc.kb.wrapper

Class SentenceWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.kb.wrapper.KbObjectWrapper
      • com.cyc.kb.wrapper.SentenceWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KbObject, KbObject.KbObjectWithArity, Sentence

    public abstract class SentenceWrapper
extends KbObjectWrapper
implements Sentence
    An abstract base class for implementing Sentences per the decorator pattern. To use, extend this class and implement the wrapped() method to return the wrapped object.

    • Nested Class Summary

        public Assertion assertIn(Context ctx)
                   throws KbException
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Assert this sentence in the context ctx. In many cases, it will be useful to call Sentence.isAssertible(com.cyc.kb.Context) before asserting a sentence.
        Specified by:
        assertIn in interface Sentence
        Parameters:
        ctx - context where this sentence will be asserted
        Returns:
        the Assertion object, either a Fact or a Rule
        Throws:
        KbException - if the assertion fails for any reason, include being syntactically invalid

      • isAssertible

        public boolean isAssertible(Context ctx)
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Checks if a given sentence meets the constraints necessary to be assertible in ctx. In particular, returns true if the arguments of the sentence are compatible with the argument constraints of the operator (i.e. could be made to actually meet the constraints without removing any existing assertions). For sentences with predicate operators, the arguments must also be compatible with all relevant interArg* constraints. In some cases, additional requirements are imposed (e.g. the constraints must actually be known to be met, not just not be known to be incompatible). For an explanation of why a particular sentence is not assertible, check Sentence.notAssertibleExplanation(com.cyc.kb.Context)
        Specified by:
        isAssertible in interface Sentence
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where semantic constraints are checked
        Returns:
        whether the sentence is compatible with all relevant syntactic and semantic constraints, and is therefore assertible

      • notAssertibleExplanation

        public String notAssertibleExplanation(Context ctx)
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Return an explanation of why the sentence is not assertible. Note that this reason may not be exhaustive; once the problems mentioned in the reason are fixed, additional calls to this method may turn up additional problems.
        Specified by:
        notAssertibleExplanation in interface Sentence
        Parameters:
        ctx - context where semantic constraints are checked
        Returns:
        a detailed explanation of why a sentence is not assertible. Returns null if it encounters an internal error.

      • getVariables

        public List<Variable> getVariables(boolean includeQueryable)
                            throws KbException
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Returns a list of the Variables in the sentence. Note that this is a copy of the variables, and modification of the returned value will not result in modifications of the Sentence.
        Specified by:
        getVariables in interface Sentence
        Parameters:
        includeQueryable - should this return the variables for which aquery would return bindings, or all free variables?
        Returns:
        a list of the variables in this sentence.
        Throws:
        KbException
        See Also:
        QuerySpecification.getQueryVariables()

      • getIndexicals

        public List<KbObject> getIndexicals(boolean includeAllIndexicals)
                             throws KbException,
                                    SessionCommunicationException
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Returns any #$IndexicalConcepts within the sentence. This method takes a boolean argument (includeAllIndexicals) which specifies whether it should return all of the indexical terms within the Sentence, or only those terms which must be resolved by the application. In other words, automatically-resolvable indexicals such as #$Now-Indexical will only be returned by this method if includeAllIndexicals is true.

        For a brief overview of indexicals, see KbObject.isIndexical().

        Specified by:
        getIndexicals in interface Sentence
        Parameters:
        includeAllIndexicals - whether to include all indexicals, or only those which must be resolved by the application
        Returns:
        the indexicals within the sentence
        Throws:
        KbException
        SessionCommunicationException
        See Also:
        KbObject.isIndexical(), Sentence.getIndexicals(), Sentence.replaceTerms(java.util.Map), QuerySpecification.getUnresolvedIndexicals(), com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification#setSubstitutions(java.util.Map), com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification#addSubstitutions(java.util.Map), QuerySpecification.getSubstitutions()

      • getIndexicals

        public List<KbObject> getIndexicals()
                             throws KbException,
                                    SessionCommunicationException
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Returns any #$IndexicalConcepts within the sentence which cannot be automatically resolved by Cyc. For example, #$Now-Indexical would not be included in the results (because Cyc can automatically resolve it to the current time) but a term like (TheNamedFn InformationStore "data source") would be included, because Cyc has no rules to resolve such a term. In other words, this method is the equivalent of passing false to Sentence.getIndexicals(boolean).

        For a brief overview of indexicals, see KbObject.isIndexical().

        Specified by:
        getIndexicals in interface Sentence
        Returns:
        a list of all indexicals which will not be automatically resolved by Cyc
        Throws:
        KbException
        SessionCommunicationException

      • replaceTerms

        public Sentence replaceTerms(Map substitutions)
                      throws KbTypeException,
                             CreateException
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Non-destructively replace a set of objects within a Sentence. This does not modify the original Sentence, but instead returns a new one. To replace terms in a Query sentence, use com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification#setSubstitutions(java.util.Map) instead.

        Note: a common use of this method is to replace indexical terms, particularly in Query sentences, so you may want to see KbObject.isIndexical() for more details about them. However, this method can be used to replace any KbObjects within a Sentence, not just indexicals.

        Specified by:
        replaceTerms in interface Sentence
        Parameters:
        substitutions - the replacement mapping
        Returns:
        a new Sentence with the replaced terms
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException
        See Also:
        Sentence.replaceTerms(java.util.List, java.util.List)

      • replaceTerms

        public Sentence replaceTerms(List<Object> from,
                             List<Object> to)
                      throws KbTypeException,
                             CreateException
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        For each element of from replace it with the element of to that's at the same index. This does not modify the original Sentence, but instead returns a new one.
        Specified by:
        replaceTerms in interface Sentence
        Parameters:
        from - a list of objects that will be replaced if found
        to - a list of objects that will be in the new modified sentence
        Returns:
        a new Sentence with the replaced terms
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException
        See Also:
        Sentence.replaceTerms(java.util.Map)

      • getArity

        public Integer getArity()
        Description copied from interface: KbObject.KbObjectWithArity
        Returns the syntactic arity of this object. If it has a getRelation applied to some arguments (i.e. it's a Sentence, an Assertion, or a functional term), the arity is the number of arguments. By convention, Cyc constants have a formula arity of 0.
        Specified by:
        getArity in interface KbObject.KbObjectWithArity
        Returns:
        the arity of this object, null if not a Cyc constant, functional term, Sentence, or Assertion

      • getArgument

        public <O> O getArgument(int argPosition)
                  throws KbTypeException,
                         CreateException
        Description copied from interface: KbObject.KbObjectWithArity
        Gets the object in argPosition argument position of this KbObject as an object of type O. This method works for Sentences and Assertions, as well as non-atomic KbTerms. However, because a constant has no "arguments", calling this method on a KbObject representing a Cyc constant will result in a KbException.
        Specified by:
        getArgument in interface KbObject.KbObjectWithArity
        Type Parameters:
        O - the object type
        Parameters:
        argPosition - the argument position of the object returned
        Returns:
        the object at getPos as a O
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • isValid

        public Boolean isValid()
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Returns true if all of terms in the Sentence are valid per KbTerm.isValid().
        Specified by:
        isValid in interface Sentence
        Returns:
        false if the KB object behind this object has been deleted or otherwise rendered invalid on the Cyc server. Returns true otherwise
